definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

pinyin: bao3 xian3 jie3 kai1 xi4 tong3

sentences.english: She returns not to untie her but just to add black tape to her gag and to put her into a hogtie.
sentences.chinese: 她返回不要解开她只是添加黑胶带呕吐，把她捆绑。

sentences.english: It's such a mystery, but the NBA seems to be demystifying the whole idea.
sentences.chinese: 他是如此神秘，但是NBA似乎有了解开秘密的注意。

sentences.english: Beattie's solution to the Franklin mystery took four expeditions and Simonson is not expecting miracles.
sentences.chinese: 比泰决心解开富兰克林探险队作过四次探险运动之迷。

sentences.english: But the mystique that surrounded the terrorist chieftain in life is persisting in death.
sentences.chinese: 但是围绕这位恐怖主义首领一生的谜团却并未解开。
但是，他还是解开了袋子。

sentences.english: You want to know why the spell didn't break, hmm, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道为什么咒语没有解开吗，嗯，维吉尔？

sentences.english: The discipline of ecology is essential for untangling these complexities.
sentences.chinese: 生态学对于解开这些复杂性至关重要。

sentences.english: Chief officer, the wire rope loose.
Please unfasten your safety belt now.
My book, Reclaim Your Dreams, can help you figure that out.
sentences.chinese: 我的书《唤回你的梦想》可以帮助解开这一切。

sentences.english: She let her hair loose and it fell around her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一解开，便顺着肩膀垂了下来。

sentences.english: We are pleased to have resolved this longstanding puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴能解开这个长期存在的谜团。

sentences.english: Untangling finances feels like playing detective to me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，解开财务问题感觉就是做一个侦探。

sentences.english: The girl started to unbind her braided hair.
sentences.chinese: 女孩开始解开编起来的头发。

sentences.english: Two astronauts spent six and a half hours unhooking a girder from the International Space Station.
sentences.chinese: 两名宇航员花了六个半小时解开国际空间站上地钢架。

sentences.english: Chen is full of sweat with heat so that he has to untie the buttons of blue shirt.
sentences.chinese: 陈老师热得满头大汗，索性将蓝色衬衣的扣子解开。

definition: a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to tie on/to buckle up/to fasten
lit. to unbutton/fig. to solve a dispute
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
